*div1 type="summary"* *p*Inscription for tomb of Moses Austin and wife, by Austin, May 16, 1830, Biographical.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*This Sacred to the memory of *person_mentioned*Moses Austin*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Maria his wife*/person_mentioned*; who departed this life at *location_mentioned*Hazel Bun St Francis County*/location_mentioned*: the first, on the *date_mentioned n="06-10-1821">10 of June 1821*/date_mentioned*. and the latter on the *date_mentioned n="01-08-1824">8 of January 1824.*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Moses Austin*/person_mentioned* was born at *location_mentioned*Durham, New Haven County State of Connecticut*/location_mentioned* on the *date_mentioned n="10-04-1765">4 of October 1765*/date_mentioned*. and was the youngest child of the Family of*person_mentioned* Elias Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Maria his wife*/person_mentioned* was born in *location_mentioned*Sussex County State*/location_mentioned* or *location_mentioned*New Jersey*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-01-1768">1 of Jany, 1768*/date_mentioned* and was the eldest *person_mentioned*daughter */person_mentioned*of *person_mentioned*Abia Brown*/person_mentioned*— They emigrated to *location_mentioned*upper Louisiana*/location_mentioned* from *location_mentioned*Virginia */location_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1798">1798 */date_mentioned*and settled the *location_mentioned*Mine A Burton*/location_mentioned* now called *location_mentioned*Potosi*/location_mentioned*— in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821 */date_mentioned*he opened a door for the settlement of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*North American Emigrants*/person_mentioned* He was distinguished for enterprise, liberality, and an honorable character. She, by all the virtues of an affectionate wife and Mother*/p*
*p*I wish my dear *person_mentioned*sister */person_mentioned*to shew the rough draft on the other page to *person_mentioned*Mr. Carr*/person_mentioned*, and get his opinion, and such alterations as he may deem proper in fact I have only put the dates etc. without giving it a proper form. *person_mentioned*Mr. Perry*/person_mentioned* can tell you that I have not even time to eat in quiet and I am now intruding upon the hours of sleep to commune a little with you—*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="05-16-1830">May 16, 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen.*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
